Here&#39;s an example:<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>Many of us take our GPS, or global positioning system, apps for granted.&nbsp; We simply input our destination into some device--for example, our smartphone or dashboard GPS system--and the app gives us step-by-step directions, telling us where to turn left and where to turn right.&nbsp; A GPS relies on three elements that work together to determine our location: satellites, ground stations and receivers.&nbsp; Satellites orbit the earth, and scientists know where each satellite is located at any given moment thanks to ground stations.&nbsp; Ground stations are located on Earth, and they use radar (a scientific technique that sends out electronic pulses that are reflected off an object back to the ground station) to confirm their position with respect to the satellites.&nbsp; A receiver (for example, your smartphone) is an object that receives signals from the satellites and figures out how far it is from four or more satellites.&nbsp; Once your receiver gets information from three satellites, your smartphone or GPS system uses a process called trilateration to pinpoint your location, and then separate mapping applications of the road systems help you navigate to your destination.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Understanding complex topics"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Active reading strategies can help!&nbsp;&nbsp; When you encounter complex reading material, break the reading into smaller pieces, each one a few sentences long.&nbsp; Then, concentrate on the shorter sections of the reading.<br /><br />Take your time.&nbsp; Expect to work slowly through challenging reading material.&nbsp; Plan to read it several times.&nbsp; Make notes of what you find or decide that each section of the reading means.<br /><br />There are a few techniques you can use as you read each section.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":1,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p><strong>1.
